body.p: “Some ice organ-pipes at the Cliffs. They appear to be formed of successive rings about half an inch thick and diamete lessening with more or less regularity to the point: Sometimes the point split in two. They the rocks are incased with ice under which water flows, -thin sheets of rippling water frozen as it flowed, -and with the sun, again apparently thawing beneath, and giving room to a new sheet of water, for under the south side of the rocks it melts almost every day.”
